## Instalation

```{r, eval=FALSE}
source("https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
biocLite('glmSparseNet')
```

# Required Packages

```{r packages, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(survival)
library(ggfortify)
# library(loose.rock)
library(futile.logger)
library(curatedTCGAData)
#
library(glmSparseNet)
#
# Some general options for futile.logger the debugging package
.Last.value <- flog.layout(layout.format('[~l] ~m'))
.Last.value <- glmSparseNet::show.message(FALSE)
# Setting ggplot2 default theme as minimal
theme_set(ggplot2::theme_minimal())
```

# Load data

The data is loaded from an online curated dataset downloaded from TCGA using `TCGAbiolinks` bioconductor package and processed.

To accelerate the process we use a very reduced dataset down to around 100 variables only *(genes)*, which is stored as a data object in this package. However, the procedure to obtain the data manually is described in the following chunk.

```{r, include=FALSE}
prad <- curatedTCGAData(diseaseCode = "PRAD", assays = "RNASeq2GeneNorm", FALSE)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
prad <- curatedTCGAData(diseaseCode = "PRAD", assays = "RNASeq2GeneNorm", FALSE)
```

```{r data.show, warning=FALSE, error=FALSE}
prad <- curatedTCGAData(diseaseCode = "PRAD", assays = "RNASeq2GeneNorm", FALSE)

# Get survival information
ydata.raw <- colData(prad) %>% as.data.frame %>% 
  # Keep only primary tumor samples
  filter(patient.samples.sample.sample_type == 'primary tumor') %>%
  # Keep only data relative to survival or samples
  select(patientID, vital_status, 
         bcr_sample_barcode = patient.samples.sample.bcr_sample_barcode,
         days_to_death,         days_to_last_followup) %>% 
  # Put sample_barcode in uppercase
  mutate(bcr_sample_barcode           = toupper(bcr_sample_barcode)) %>%
  # Find max time between all days (ignoring missings)
  rowwise %>%
  mutate(time = max(days_to_last_followup, days_to_death, na.rm = T)) %>%
  # Keep only survival variables and codes
  select(patientID, bcr_sample_barcode, status = vital_status, time) %>% 
  # Discard individuals with survival time less or equal to 0
  filter(time > 0) %>% as.data.frame

# Set index as the patientID
rownames(ydata.raw) <- ydata.raw$patientID

# Get Assay data
xdata.raw <- t(assay(prad[[1]]))

# Get matches between survival and assay data
common.codes <- ydata.raw$bcr_sample_barcode[ydata.raw$bcr_sample_barcode %in% strtrim(rownames(xdata.raw), 16)]
xdata.raw    <- xdata.raw[strtrim(rownames(xdata.raw), 16) %in% common.codes, ]
xdata.raw    <- xdata.raw %>% { (apply(., 2, sd) != 0) } %>% { xdata.raw[, .] } %>% scale

# Order ydata the same as assay
ydata.raw    <- ydata.raw[strtrim(rownames(xdata.raw), 12), ]


set.seed(params$seed)
small.subset <- c(gene.names(c('ENSG00000103091', 'ENSG00000064787', 'ENSG00000119915', 
                               'ENSG00000120158', 'ENSG00000114491', 'ENSG00000204176', 
                               'ENSG00000138399'))$external_gene_name, 
                  sample(colnames(xdata.raw), 100)) %>% unique %>% sort

xdata <- xdata.raw[, small.subset[small.subset %in% colnames(xdata.raw)]]
ydata <- ydata.raw %>% select(time, status)
```

# Fit models

Fit model model penalizing by the hubs using the cross-validation function by `cv.glmHub`.

```{r fit}
set.seed(params$seed)
fitted <- cv.glmHub(xdata, Surv(ydata$time, ydata$status),
                    family  = 'cox',
                    nlambda = 1000,
                    network = 'correlation', 
                    network.options = network.options.default(cutoff = .6, 
                                                              min.degree = .2))
```

# Results of Cross Validation

Shows the results of `100` different parameters used to find the optimal value in 10-fold cross-validation. The two vertical dotted lines represent the best model and a model with less variables selected *(genes)*, but within a standard error distance from the best.

```{r results}
plot(fitted)
```

## Coefficients of selected model from Cross-Validation

Taking the best model described by `lambda.min`

```{r show_coefs}
coefs.v <- coef(fitted, s = 'lambda.min')[,1] %>% { .[. != 0]}
coefs.v %>% { 
  data.frame(ensembl.id  = names(.), 
             gene.name   = gene.names(names(.))$external_gene_name, 
             coefficient = .,
             stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
  } %>%
  arrange(gene.name) %>%
  knitr::kable()
```

## Hallmarks of Cancer

```{r hallmarks}
gene.names(names(coefs.v)) %>% { hallmarks(.$external_gene_name)$heatmap }
```

## Survival curves and Log rank test

```{r}
draw.kaplan(as.vector(coefs.v), 
            xdata[, names(coefs.v)], 
            ydata, 
            plot.title = 'Full dataset', legend.outside = F)
```
